intro: Guettarda eximia, commonly known as the golden glory or tropical hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability. Guettarda eximia is also valued for its ability to grow in various soil types, making it a popular choice for landscaping in tropical and subtropical regions.
